page.title: 021086 CHARTER
page.content: the war torn towns. In 1086 the Abbots of the Priory at St. Neots were granted a charter allowing them to build a watermill for milling flour.The site is still in use as a mill but now produces glued paper products. Although the mill provides employment for many in the village more find work outside the immediate area. This maybe because of relative cheap housing ,pleasant surroundings, and good road and rail facilities for travel to and from work. The population is "young" and most of the parents have children at the Primary school.Those pupils requiring secondary and higher education have to travel out of the village to receive an education.
